widget.title: List
widget.p: A list allows the user to select one or more objects from a list, and internally handles scrolling. The following example list has three items, the first is selected and the last is disabled, allows to select multiple items.
widget.xul: <list selection="multiple"> <item text="List" selected="true" /> <item text="Item"/> <item text="Disabled" enabled="false" /> </list>

parameters.parameter: Possible values are: single, interval, and multiple. The default single value allows to select one list item at a time, the interval value to select one contiguous range of items, and the multiple value to select one or more contiguous ranges of items.
Calls the method whenever the selection changes.
Calls the method whenever a perform event (double-click) occurs.
If present and set to false, don't draw lines separating the list items.
name, enabled, visible, tooltip, property, width, height, colspan, rowspan, weightx, weighty, halign, and valign parameters are similar to component

widget.title: Item
widget.p: List contains items, items display a short text string and an image and can be selected.

parameters.parameter: True if the item currently selected.
name, enabled, text, icon, alignment, tooltip, and property parameters are similar to combobox choice
